ext_descriptions.ext_description: A padstack_arrangement lists the types of the padstack arrangement.
specifies that padstack is arranged from the top;
specifies that padstack is arranged from the bottom;
specifies that padstack is arranged symmetrically;

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The of padstacks of padstack shall be equal to footprint_location.
The footprint_location shall be "top" if and only if the padstack location is "top".
The footprint_location shall be "bottom" if and only if the padstack location is "bottom".
The footprint_location shall be "symmetrical" if and only if the padstack location is "symmetrical".

A Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition is the product structure relationship that specifies the composition role a padstack definition plays in a . Not every padstack definition may be used in a .

ext_description.p: The location of the reference terminal specified by reference_package_terminal shall be commensurate with the transform in a geometric sense, that is the location of the terminal shall be such that "metal to metal" contact is assured.
ext_description.note: CAD system differences and idealization differences may prohibit mathematically exact co-location.

A Part_template_location_in_fd_or_pd is the relationship that identifies the location of a in a or a . A Part_template_location_in_fd_or_pd may be a
or a . The Application Object references a
in the formal model since there is a one to one relationship between a
and the associated . There is exactly one
allowed to reference a Part_template_location_in_fd_or_pd. There is an optional reference to the parametric data necessary to define the shape of material to be added at the intersection of the assembly occurrence and the trace that intersects that occurrence. A parametric model is provided and not an explicit shape model because the actual angle the trace makes with respect to the assembly occurrence is unknown, and there may be more than one intersection. This model only provides support for one parametric configuration for this data for the Part_template_location_in_fd_or_pd. In the event that trimming of a shape between the trace and the assembly occurrence is to be exchanged, the use of an instance in the design of is appropriate. If the transform attribute exists, then the parametric data shall not be provided. If the parametric data is provided, the transform shall not be provided.
ext_description.note: The is a geometric shape concept with the result that this requires exactly one shape for the used in a location.

ext_description.p:
A Part_template_planar_keepout_shape_model is a type of , , . A Part_template_planar_keepout_shape_model is the projected shape of a keepout region around the
in two dimensions.
ext_description.note:
Keepout regions typically include some minimal spacing around the extreme shape represented by
where the exact relationship between the two shapes is unrecorded.

There may be multiple Part_template_planar_keepout_shape_model for a particular purpose. The recommended method to aggregate several Part_template_planar_keepout_shape_model that together describe a volumetric constraint is to reference them from a member of .

shall not be populated.

A Stratum_type_independent_padstack_definition is a type of that shall be applied to all of a design, irrespective of the type of individual .

The get_padstack_arrangement functions gets the value that is consistent with all Padstack_location_in_footprint_definitions specified by input.
It returns if there is at least one specified in input that has of set to and there are no Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition specified in input that have of set to .
